channel.title: AI-Pulse - IoT - Internet of Things
channel.description: IoT - Internet of Things news from AI-Pulse

item.title: Object detection with Ultralytics YOLO26 on Raspberry Pi
item.description: Use Docker and Ultralytics YOLO26 to perform object detection on images and video files with Raspberry Pi. The post Object detection with Ultralytics YOLO26 on Raspberry Pi appeared first on Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Building a Desk Sized Kodak Photo Kiosk
item.description: snappiness built a mini Kodak Picture Maker for their desk that is able to print photos and shared the project build on YouTube Grab a MEMENTO when they’re back in stock so you can have even more photos to print!

item.title: Susan B. Anthony Day 20216 #SusanBAnthony #SusanBAnthonyDay
item.description: Today is Susan B. Anthony Day. We celebrate on February 15th, what would be her 206th birthday! Anthony was an American social reformer, women’s rights activist, and brilliant orator who played a pivotal role in the women’s suffrage movement. In her last speech ended with the words “Failure is impossible!” Honor her legacy and vote! […]

item.title: Here’s Our First Gemini Deep Think LLM-Assisted Hardware Design
item.description: We’ve been using LLMs for years to do software and firmware assistance. Now we’re starting to look at it for hardware help too. Ladyada’s still in the driver’s seat… but now with a robotic co-pilot! For this basic STEMMA QT breakout we’re going to feature the MAX44009 wide-range lux sensor, aaaand we really wanted to […]

item.title: Twisted Heart Vase #3DPrinting
item.description: Gyrobot‘s 2013 twisted heart vase print may be the perfect gift for your Valentine! Check out the instructions on Thingiverse. Another heart, another vase, but with a twist. Give something presented in this “thing” and offer your heart forever(ish). Watch my twisted heart change colour : http://youtu.be/vf1HOLNgc1w Good for Valentines.

item.title: Adafruit Weekly Editorial Round-Up: Full-circle Test-driven Firmware Development with OpenClaw, Hacking Yoto Music Players, & More
item.description: ADAFRUIT WEEKLY EDITORIAL ROUND-UP We’ve got so much happening here at Adafruit that it’s not always easy to keep up! Don’t fret, we’ve got you covered. Each week we’ll be posting a handy round-up of what we’ve been up to, ranging from learn guides to blog articles, videos, and more. “Any User Who Has a […]

item.title: MakeCode Arcade 2026 Update
item.description: It’s update time for MakeCode Arcade! Microsoft just posted the latest news on the latest features added to the excellent drag-and-drop (or text code-able if you like) game creation engine. Here are some highlights: Reliability & Stability Code Evaluation Error Explainer Tutorial Sharing Keyboard Controls Game Description Asset Packs Tilemap Gallery YouTube Education video player […]

item.title: Meta Wants to Scan Every Face You Walk Past
item.description: The New York Times reported yesterday that Meta plans to add facial recognition to its Ray-Ban smart glasses, possibly this year. The feature, internally called “Name Tag,” (face rape is for another product) would let wearers identify people through Meta’s AI assistant. Seven million pairs sold last year. An internal Meta document from May, obtained […]

item.title: Making Lamps with Bamboo and Paper
item.description: Anyone in need of a super chill and aesthetic DIY build video is going to adore PearFleur’s bamboo and paper lamp build on YouTube. We have a selection of lamp builds in the Adafruit Learning System. Check out the two builds below that give us similar vibes to PearFleur’s creations. Hacking Ikea Lamps with Circuit […]

item.title: From PDF to .LBR: Using Deep Think to Write Custom CAD Parts
item.description: This is the image that Deep Think generated to demonstrate its output, the QFN corner pads don’t have as bad of an intersection in the actual footprint created but we did need to push the four rows out about half a mm. The overall dimensions, pad sizes and order were otherwise correct! It happened over […]

item.title: Agentic AI Chip Design, Networking Chip, Edge AI: Embedded Week Insights
item.description: Here's a roundup of this week's must-read articles. We look into the latest developments on Cadence Agentic AI, Cisco's Silicon One G300 Switch, Microchip's full-stack edge AI solutions, and more. Also, check News Archives - Embedded and Technical Articles Archives - Embedded for the complete list of news and articles from our website. NEWS Cisco Unveils Silicon One G300 [...] The post Agentic AI Chip Design, Networking Chip, Edge AI: Embedded Week Insights appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: LEGO Toaster
item.description: BricksOnSet shared this really cool LEGO toaster they debuted at Atlanta BrickCon on Reddit. Check it out! I debuted it this past weekend at Atlanta BrickCon and it won the Master Brick award. There’s a round gear on the toast that engages a straight gear on the front carriage as it goes down. It locks […]

item.title: Subscribe to the Adafruit Youtube channel! #Youtube #AdafruitLearnSystem
item.description: Are you subscribed to the Adafruit Youtube channel? If you’re not already subscribed, click here! http://adafru.it/subscribe . It’s a free and easy way to keep up with our newest episodes. Here’s some of what we’re up to. Electronics Show and Tell Wednesdays 7:30pm Electronics show and tell every Wednesday at 7:30pm ET. Adafruit Ask […]

item.title: John Park’s CircuitPython Parsec: Trellis Line Fill
item.description: #circuitpythonparsec Fill a line of NeoPixels between two end points on NeoTrellis driver boards (or MechaTrellis as shown here — currently sold out, but open source). code example To learn about CircuitPython: https://circuitpython.org

item.title: Custom Modded Friday the 13th Arcade 1up Cabinet #piday #raspberrypi
item.description: Happy Friday the 13th! A couple years back Reddit user u/valentino_42 took a Mortal Kombat II 1up Arcade and upgraded it to a RetroPie Friday the 13th cabinet: The guts of the machine are a Raspberry Pi 5 that interfaces with usb encoders going to the buttons. I’d never worked with a pi before, but I followed […]

item.title: Teenage Engineering EP-40 Teardown
item.description: Here’s a terrific teardown of the Teenage Engineering portable sample station, the EP-40 Riddim. The line of EP samplers are in many ways the evolution of the minimalist Pocket Operator series (which are as barebones as can be) and this post and accompanying video take a fantastic deep dive into the mechanical engineering of the […]

item.title: Babylon 5 Is now free to watch on YouTube #SciFi #Space
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery has begun uploading full episodes of the iconic series Babylon 5 to YouTube, providing free access to the show just as it departs from the ad-supported streaming platform Tubi. The uploads started with the pilot episode, “The Gathering,” which serves as the entry point to the series’ intricate universe. This was followed […]

item.title: Broadband IoT vs. Narrowband IoT: Enterprise Connectivity Strategies for 2026 and Beyond
item.description: This article compares broadband and narrowband IoT for enterprises in 2026, detailing technologies like LTE-M, NB-IoT, 5G RedCap, and satellite NTN to guide connectivity strategy decisions. The post Broadband IoT vs. Narrowband IoT: Enterprise Connectivity Strategies for 2026 and Beyond appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Deutsche Telekom unveils multi-orbit IoT roaming
item.description: Deutsche Telekom introduces multi-orbit IoT roaming, combining GEO and LEO satellite coverage with terrestrial networks to deliver reliable, global NB-IoT connectivity for various IoT applications across remote and challenging environments. The post Deutsche Telekom unveils multi-orbit IoT roaming appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: How SPAD Imaging Improves Perception in Industrial Robotics
item.description: SPAD sensors are an alternative imaging solution for embedded industrial robotics systems thanks to their photon-level imaging. The post How SPAD Imaging Improves Perception in Industrial Robotics appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Certifying third-party antennas for use with Raspberry Pi Compute Modules
item.description: Raspberry Pi can help industrial and commercial customers using alternative antennas meet different compliance requirements around the world. The post Certifying third-party antennas for use with Raspberry Pi Compute Modules appeared first on Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Tasking Announces Integrated Embedded Software Toolchain
item.description: On the first anniversary of its acquisition of LDRA, Tasking has announced the availability of its integrated toolchain. Following the successful unification of LDRA and Tasking technologies, the combined solution delivers end-to-end capabilities combining compilation, debugging, and testing within a single development environment. AI-assisted features further support the accelerated development of functionally safe and secure [...] The post Tasking Announces Integrated Embedded Software Toolchain appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Building the ultimate turntable for 3D scanning
item.description: When you buy a 3D scanner, it will probably come with a turntable to spin the subject part and help you get a consistent scan from all sides. But almost all of those turntables are flimsy, shaky, and lack any fixturing provisions for parts, diminishing their utility. That’s why Chris Borge used an Arduino to […] The post Building the ultimate turntable for 3D scanning appeared first on Arduino Blog.

item.title: Seco to Demo IoT and Software Framework at Embedded World
item.description: Seco will showcase Clea, its IoT and AI software framework, at embedded world 2026, through a series of interactive demonstrations. The modular software framework simplifies the adoption of edge AI at scale by connecting hardware, software, and AI into a single, production-ready ecosystem. It supports the entire edge AI process from application development to deployment [...] The post Seco to Demo IoT and Software Framework at Embedded World appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Netmore Launches Pulse Partner Program for IoT Growth
item.description: Netmore introduces the Pulse partner program to unify IoT ecosystems, offering structured tiers, onboarding, and joint go-to-market support to accelerate scalable IoT solutions and drive global market growth. The post Netmore Launches Pulse Partner Program for IoT Growth appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Accessibility improvements for screen readers on raspberrypi.com
item.description: We’ve updated our pages, forms, and CAPTCHA infrastructure on raspberrypi.com to improve accessibility for screen reader users. The post Accessibility improvements for screen readers on raspberrypi.com appeared first on Raspberry Pi.

item.title: How VPNs Help Improve Online Privacy Across Location-Based Platforms
item.description: This article examines how VPNs improve online privacy by protecting user location data, enabling access to geo-restricted content, securing public networks, and enhancing security for IoT devices and multiple platforms. The post How VPNs Help Improve Online Privacy Across Location-Based Platforms appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Everyday Productivity Challenges in IoT Projects and How Teams Solve Them
item.description: IoT project teams face challenges like device integration delays, data inconsistencies, and security disruptions. Adopting standards, automation, and scalable practices improves productivity and project success. The post Everyday Productivity Challenges in IoT Projects and How Teams Solve Them appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Cisco Unveils Silicon One G300 AI Networking Chip
item.description: Cisco Systems Inc. has announced the Silicon One G300, an innovative 102.4 Tbits/s switching chip designed to address the growing demands of AI data centers in the agentic era. This new silicon powers the next-generation Cisco N9000 and Cisco 8000 switch systems, setting new benchmarks in performance, efficiency, and scalability. Engineered for hyperscale, enterprise, and sovereign [...] The post Cisco Unveils Silicon One G300 AI Networking Chip appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Empower Unveils High-Density Silicon Capacitors
item.description: Empower Semiconductor has released three new embedded silicon capacitors (ECAPs) for AI and high-performance computing (HPC) processing. Addressing power integrity demands as AI processors push performance higher, the ECAP portfolio delivers higher capacitance density in a small footprint. The ECAP portfolio meets the dimensional and tolerance requirements for embedding in AI and HPC processors. These new [...] The post Empower Unveils High-Density Silicon Capacitors appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Smart city technologies gain global momentum across core urban services
item.description: Smart city technologies including smart street lighting, parking, waste collection, air quality monitoring, and surveillance are expanding globally, with Europe leading adoption and Asia-Pacific seeing the fastest growth toward 2029. The post Smart city technologies gain global momentum across core urban services appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Monogoto and Nordic Semiconductor to Advance nuSIM IoT Connectivity
item.description: Monogoto teams with Nordic Semiconductor to promote nuSIM integrated SIM technology, enabling secure, low-power, and seamless global connectivity for IoT devices through simplified design and deployment. The post Monogoto and Nordic Semiconductor to Advance nuSIM IoT Connectivity appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: GCT Semiconductor and Skylo partner on satellite IoT
item.description: GCT Semiconductor and Skylo Technologies have partnered to advance satellite connectivity, focusing on chip and module certification to support seamless IoT device connections in remote areas. The post GCT Semiconductor and Skylo partner on satellite IoT appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: WiseTech and Hapag-Lloyd launch IoT container tracking pilot
item.description: WiseTech and Hapag-Lloyd have partnered to launch an IoT container tracking pilot, integrating real-time location data and dynamic ETA features into logistics platforms for improved supply chain visibility. The post WiseTech and Hapag-Lloyd launch IoT container tracking pilot appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Microchip Expands Full-Stack Edge AI Solutions
item.description: Microchip Technology Inc. has expanded its edge AI portfolio with full-stack solutions designed to simplify the development and deployment of production-ready AI applications on its microcontrollers (MCUs), microprocessors (MPUs), and FPGAs. The new offering combines silicon, software, and development tools to address performance, power, and security constraints typical of edge environments. Microchip's MCUs and MPUs [...] The post Microchip Expands Full-Stack Edge AI Solutions appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: The MicroBox is a handheld game console that runs on an Arduino UNO R4
item.description: That shiny new Arduino UNO R4 board that you got has quite a bit of power under the hood, thanks to its Renesas RA4M1 Cortex-M4 microcontroller. It has more than enough power to run games and one great way to take advantage of that is by building Szymon Kubica’s MicroBox handheld console. The MicroBox design […] The post The MicroBox is a handheld game console that runs on an Arduino UNO R4 appeared first on Arduino Blog.

item.title: Cadence Unveils AI Agent to Accelerate Chip Design
item.description: Cadence unveils its ChipStack AI Super Agent agentic AI solution for automating chip design and verification, providing 10× productivity improvements. The post Cadence Unveils AI Agent to Accelerate Chip Design appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Cellular IoT Modules Market Outlook 2025-2026: Strong Growth in 2025, Structural Pressures Ahead
item.description: The cellular IoT modules market expects significant growth in 2025 led by China, India, and LTE Cat.1 bis adoption, despite pressures from pricing, DRAM shortages, and the 4G to 5G transition. The post Cellular IoT Modules Market Outlook 2025-2026: Strong Growth in 2025, Structural Pressures Ahead appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: From Connected Devices to Autonomous Operations: What Enterprise IoT Is Really Becoming
item.description: The latest IoT Analytics report reveals enterprise IoT's shift from connectivity projects to embedded, autonomous operations focused on resilience, ROI, and operational intelligence across industries. The post From Connected Devices to Autonomous Operations: What Enterprise IoT Is Really Becoming appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Infineon Acquires ams Osram's Non-Optical Sensor Portfolio
item.description: Infineon Technologies AG has announced a strategic acquisition of the non-optical analog/mixed-signal sensor portfolio from ams Osram Group. This €570 million deal, structured on a debt-free and cash-free basis, is expected to enhance Infineon's capabilities in automotive, industrial, and medical applications. The acquired business is projected to generate approximately €230 million in revenue by 2026, [...] The post Infineon Acquires ams Osram’s Non-Optical Sensor Portfolio appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: Partnership to Deliver AI-Native, 6G-Ready Solutions
item.description: SynaXG and Tech Mahindra announced a partnership to focus on the development of AI-RAN solutions that improve wireless network performance, spectrum efficiency, and power consumption. The post Partnership to Deliver AI-Native, 6G-Ready Solutions appeared first on Embedded.

item.title: A weather station built specifically for model rocket launches
item.description: When NASA or SpaceX launches a rocket, it is important for them to monitor the real-time local weather conditions to adjust parameters or even delay until conditions are more favorable. Model rocket launches are just as affected by weather — more so, in fact, because they have so much less mass. That’s why Markus Bindhammer […] The post A weather station built specifically for model rocket launches appeared first on Arduino Blog.

item.title: Pioreactor: An automated Raspberry Pi bioreactor
item.description: Run automated bioreactor experiments on your desk with Pioreactor, designed for use with any model of Raspberry Pi. The post Pioreactor: An automated Raspberry Pi bioreactor appeared first on Raspberry Pi.

item.title: Private LTE/5G Market Reached US$2.4B and 6,500 Deployments in 2025
item.description: The private LTE/5G network market hit $2.4 billion and 6,500 deployments in 2025, with growth forecasted to $12 billion by 2030 due to enterprise demand, new deployments, and technology upgrades. The post Private LTE/5G Market Reached US$2.4B and 6,500 Deployments in 2025 appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Retrouvez nous sur Tech Inn’Vitré les 14 et 15 février 2026
item.description: Les 14 et 15 février 2026, je vous donne rendez-vous à Vitré pour le salon Tech Inn’Vitré (Usages numériques), organisé par Vitré Communauté et Makeme. Deux jours pour découvrir des usages concrets du numérique, tester, manipuler… et surtout échanger “en vrai” ! . Tech Inn’Vitré 2026 : rendez-vous les 14 & 15 février au Centre […] Cet article Retrouvez nous sur Tech Inn’Vitré les 14 et 15 février 2026 a été publié en premier sur Framboise 314, le Raspberry Pi à la sauce française.....

item.title: Texas Instruments to acquire Silicon Labs
item.description: Texas Instruments will acquire Silicon Labs in a $7.5 billion cash deal, merging their embedded wireless and analog capabilities to enhance IoT connectivity and manufacturing efficiency, targeting accelerated growth and customer reach. The post Texas Instruments to acquire Silicon Labs appeared first on IoT Business News.

item.title: Save the date: Arduino Days 2026 is coming!
item.description: Mark your calendars for March 27-28, 2026, as we come together for Arduino Days 2026 – our annual online event for everyone, everywhere. As we step into 2026, we embrace an exciting paradigm shift in technology, ready to explore the new world of AI. For the past two decades, Arduino has been a favorite of […] The post Save the date: Arduino Days 2026 is coming! appeared first on Arduino Blog.

item.title: Beige is back: Remembering the BBC Micro with Raspberry Pi 500+
item.description: In a polite nod to four decades of British computing, we modified a Raspberry Pi 500+ to look like a BBC Micro. The post Beige is back: Remembering the BBC Micro with Raspberry Pi 500+ appeared first on Raspberry Pi.

item.title: 3D printing with a 4,000-pound industrial robot
item.description: There are industrial robots, and there is Brian Brocken’s two-ton behemoth: an ABB IRB6400 capable of moving at least 150kg (330 pounds), thanks to partial hydraulic actuation. It is an absurd robot that a factory might use to put small engines in cars. So, it is an understatement to say it was overkill when Brocken […] The post 3D printing with a 4,000-pound industrial robot appeared first on Arduino Blog.

item.title: IoT Data Collection in ATEX Environments
item.description: This article examines IoT data collection in ATEX-certified hazardous zones, detailing sensor requirements, connectivity evolution, and integration challenges for safe, reliable industrial deployments. The post IoT Data Collection in ATEX Environments appeared first on IoT Business News.
